text:
With a modeling career that spans decades and numerous other gigs that have kept her in front of the camera steadily adding to her legacy, Heidi Klum has enjoyed an amount of longevity that isn’t commonly seen in the modeling or entertainment industry. So what exactly is her secret to showing up to every job, booking or photoshoot looking like a million bucks?

The beauty has given birth to four children and still looks like the model she was before she had kids when she started in the 90s over 20 years ago.

Klum is finally revealing her secret. She loves to exfoliate.

What’s even better is that her favorite exfoliating scrub can be found at drugstores in the UK. It’s called Aapri.

Klum believes that it’s essential to exfoliate twice a week as it helps to rejuvenate the skin.

This also helps to prompt the skin to turn over and be made new quicker as this is a natural process our skin does over time.

Scrubs like this can help to get rid of the dead skin that accumulates on the face and body.

The model, mom and TV personality says she tries to keep it simple when it comes to her skincare. She also loves Mario Badescu’s Buttermilk Creme.

Another important tip that she swears by is letting her skin rest.

The beauty keeps makeup to an absolute minimum when she isn’t on set.

Makeup, dirt, and debris easily clog up the pores of the skin. This can lead to breakouts, sensitivities, and skin that starts to look less elastic. So letting the skin breathe is essential.

While genes certainly have something to do with it, Klum doesn’t think it’s that hard to maintain a serious radiance and glow.

Expensive products are also not necessary in the grand scheme of what can be used to nourish and treat skin.
